news.title: Bullets Part Ways with Pasuwa
news.content:
By Sports Correspondent

Nyasa Big Bullets FC have opted not to renew the contract of Zimbabwean coach Kalisto Pasuwa, which is set to expire on December 31.

This decision follows Pasuwas inability to defend three out of the four trophies the team secured last year.

A club official has confirmed that Pasuwa was informed of the decision last month, and his contract will not be extended.

news.title: Accidents: 77 Killed
news.content:
Harare, December 28, 2024 At least 77 people have lost their lives, and 401 others were injured in 1,211 road traffic accidents recorded across Zimbabwe during the holiday period from December 15 to yesterday, according to the Zimbabwe Republic Police (ZRP).

The grim statistics show an increase in fatalities compared to the same period last year when 71 people were killed and 393 others injured in 1,454 accidents.

In a statement, national police spokesperson Commissioner Paul Nyathi attributed many of the accidents to driver fatigue and negligence. Most road traffic accidents involved private vehicles where either drivers or passengers perished. The only major road traffic accident involving public service vehicles was recorded on December 22, 2024, when three buses collided, resulting in two fatalities, Comm Nyathi said.

Daily Toll Highlights

December 22, 2024: 106 accidents recorded, with seven fatalities and 38 injuries.

Christmas Day: 104 accidents, leaving 13 dead and 16 injured.

December 26, 2024: 87 accidents, resulting in 11 deaths and 40 injuries.

Comm Nyathi also highlighted an alarming trend of pedestrian-related accidents, emphasizing the need for drivers to be cautious, especially in built-up areas and residential zones.

Safety Appeal to Motorists

The ZRP reiterated its call for motorists to adhere to road regulations, urging them to avoid speeding, reckless overtaking, and overloading vehicles. Above all, motorists are implored not to overload vehicles when travelling on the countrys roads. Errant drivers should be reported to the nearest police station or the National Complaints Desk, Comm Nyathi said, providing the hotline number 0242 703631 and WhatsApp line 0712 800 197 for public use.

Enhanced Police Deployment

To ensure peace and safety during the festive season, the ZRP has increased its presence on major roads, residential areas, and public gathering spots. Measures include heightened roadblocks, traffic blitzes, and both motorized and cycle patrols.

Police have also issued a stern warning to motorcyclists riding without helmets and those carrying passengers unsafely. Crackdowns are underway on individuals involved in drug and substance abuse, as well as those violating regulations on fireworks and other celebratory gadgets.

Call for Responsibility

Comm Nyathi urged transport operators and the general public to prioritize safety and security during the holiday period. As we approach the New Year celebrations, we call on all stakeholders to adhere to the law to ensure a peaceful and safe environment for everyone, he said.

The ZRP remains committed to enforcing road safety measures and maintaining public order as the festive season continues.

news.title: No Mercy For Paedophiles
news.content:
By A Correspondent

The courts are sending a strong message to paedophiles who destroy childrens lives, with the recent incarceration of two men who were convicted and sentenced to 20 years imprisonment each. Protecting children against paedophiles is being prioritised by the courts, with lengthy custodial sentences being handed down.

In one recent case, a 32-year-old man was sentenced to 20 years in prison for raping his four-year-old niece. The abuse was reported by a neighbour who overheard the child telling a friend about the incident, leading to the mans arrest.

Another case involved a 24-year-old man from Mutare who was sentenced to 20 years in prison for drugging and raping a nine-year-old girl in his car. The offender kidnapped the child, forced her to drink alcohol, and then raped her. The girls mother discovered the abuse after noticing that her child had contracted a sexually transmitted disease.

In a particularly disturbing case, a 23-year-old man was arrested and arraigned in court for allegedly raping his one-year-old daughter. The man was left babysitting while his wife carried out household chores, and it is alleged that he removed the babys diaper and raped her once. The childs mother discovered the abuse when she entered the room and found her child lying on the floor, bleeding with her diaper removed. The accused was remanded in custody pending his trial, set for next month.

news.title: Mnangagwa “Plots ” Chiwenga Ouster
news.content:
By A Correspondent

Zimbabwean President Emmerson Mnangagwa has indicated that significant changes are on the horizon, with a Cabinet reshuffle expected soon.

The Zanu PF leader made these remarks during a recent interview with ZBC News at State House.

Sources suggest that Mnangagwa is preparing to restructure his Cabinet to reduce the influence of those perceived to be loyal to his deputy, Constantino Chiwenga.

This move is seen as part of an ongoing power struggle within the ruling party.

Ndiri kumirira kuti vanhu vapedze kufara ndozovaudza vanofanira kudzoka kubasa nevanofanira kugara kumba depending ne performance, Mnangagwa stated in the interview. In English, he said, I am waiting for people to finish celebrating, then I will tell them who should return to work and who should stay at home, depending on performance.

This statement has fuelled speculation that the reshuffle may be a calculated move to strengthen Mnangagwas grip on both the party and government by sidelining those whose allegiance may lie with Chiwenga.

Tensions have reportedly been rising within Zanu PF, with various factions vying for power and influence following the 2023 elections.

Additionally, with constitutional provisions stating that Mnangagwa is not expected to remain in office beyond 2028, these moves could also be seen as preparations for a transition of leadership.

As Zimbabweans await the reshuffle, Mnangagwas comments have set the stage for potential political shifts, with many closely monitoring the developments within the ruling party.

news.title: Zim Veteran Batsman Shines
news.content:
Sports Correspondent

Zimbabwe delivered a commanding performance on the opening day of the Boxing Day Test against Afghanistan, finishing at 363 for 4 at Queens Sports Club on Thursday.

Veteran batsman Sean Williams notched his fifth Test century, leading the charge for the hosts. Playing at his home ground, Williams showcased his full range of shots on a wicket that offered some turn. He utilized excellent footwork to dominate Afghanistans bowlers throughout the day.

Williams formed a crucial 143-run partnership for the sixth wicket with captain Craig Ervine, who was unbeaten on 56 at stumps.

Earlier in the day, debutant Ben Curran provided a strong foundation for Zimbabwe with a quick-fire 64 off 71 balls. However, his opening partner, Joylord Gumbie, was dismissed early for 9. Takudzwanashe Kaitano made a solid start but was caught out for 45, while also providing vital support to Williams. Dion Myers added a brief but valuable cameo as well.

Zimbabwe made three debutants for the match  opening batsman Ben Curran, and bowlers Newman Nyamhuri and Trevor Gwandu  while veterans Victor Nyauchi and Richard Ngarava were left out.

With a strong foundation laid, Zimbabwe will look to build a significant total on day two before inviting Afghanistan to bat.

news.title: Zimbabwe to Introduce Parole System in Effort to Decongest Prisons
news.content:
By A Correspondent

The Zimbabwean government is set to introduce a parole system next year as part of efforts to reduce overcrowding in the countrys prisons. The local prison population currently stands at approximately 21,000, surpassing the facilities capacity of 17,000 inmates. In response, the government is developing strategies to improve prison conditions, aligning them with international standards.

Zimbabwe Prisons and Correctional Service (ZPCS) Commissioner General, Moses Chihobvu, confirmed that plans to implement the parole system are well advanced. The parole system is now at an advanced stage. What remains is benchmarking against countries with established programs and conducting awareness campaigns to inform the public, he stated.

Legal experts have hailed the move as a significant step towards reforming the prison system, shifting the focus from punishment to rehabilitation and reintegration. According to lawyer Rungano Mahuni, the parole system allows offenders to serve part of their sentence before being considered for early release under specific conditions. This system offers inmates the opportunity to reintegrate into society while reducing the risk of further criminal behavior. When individuals spend time with habitual criminals in prison, it increases the likelihood of them adopting negative behaviors, Mahuni explained.

Another lawyer, Kudzai Tichawangana, added that the parole system would help alleviate prison overcrowding. After a thorough vetting process, deserving inmates could be granted early release, which would also create healthier conditions for those remaining in prison. Inmates would have the chance to return home and support their families while finishing their terms outside prison, Tichawangana said.

The proposed parole system would allow for the conditional early release of prisoners, subject to approval by the President, the State Parole Board, the Commissioner-General of Prisons, or the Minister of Prisons and Correctional Services. While on parole, prisoners will be supervised by parole officers but will enjoy more freedom and be allowed to return to their families. Key factors for consideration in granting parole include an inmates conduct, self-discipline, and industriousness while in prison.

Essa gangue da OJM que est a a andar na rua e diz que est a limpar, muitos deles so pagos. Vo l s cadeias visitar as pessoas que esto detidas, saber se ainda esto vivas ou se no esto vivas. Vo l dar assistncia de advogados s pessoas que neste momento esto a precisar de advogados. Vo l dar assistncia s famlias que perderam os seus filhos, assassinados pela prpria FRELIMO, que at hoje no sabemos se esto a ser enterrados, se no esto a ser enterrados, se esto a ser lanados pela vaga comum. Ento parem de fazer manipulao, de andar a tentar varer ruas, para enganar o povo, para tentar baralhar o povo. Ns no vamos perder o nosso foco, ns no vamos perder a ideia que temos de que estas manifestaes devem continuar at a reposio da verdade eleitoral, devem continuar at que se faa justia em Moambique. E a prpria polcia at hoje no fala de desenvolver nenhum inqurito, de organizar nenhum inqurito para esclarecer quem que libertou os presos, no est preocupado. A nica coisa que o Bernardino Rafael est preocupado  de mostrar ao povo que vem a terror, de que vo violar mulheres. de que vai haver assaltos  mo armada, de que vo matar pessoas, de que vai haver muito crime. Ele no diz que aqueles que mataram 100 jovens que estavam l detidos, o que vai acontecer com eles. Ele no diz isto. Tudo manipulao. Graas a Deus, a Farlimo deu um tiro no prprio p. Toda a comunidade internacional agora est ciente de que de fato a FRELIMO  um movimento terrorista, que a FRELIMO  que est a criar assassinatos, a FRELIMO  que est a criar terror em Moambique. Olha para os noticirios internacionais, vo ver, morreram pessoas, mas a FRELIMO deu um tiro no prprio p. A imagem da FRELIMO a nvel internacional est totalmente manchada. Est totalmente manchada,  por isso que at hoje o governo dos Estados Unidos no reconheceu essa corda do Conselho Constitucional, a Inglaterra no reconheceu essa corda do Conselho Constitucional, a Unio Europeia no reconheceu essa corda do Conselho Constitucional, Portugal, hoje, j esto a mudar de discurso, porque tinham cometido uma GAF, esto a mudar porque toda a comunidade portuguesa est a dizer que o governo cometeu uma GAF, que no devia reconhecer os resultados. Ento, neste momento, at a SADC se tenha vindo a afirmar que a Frelimo e o candidato ganharam hoje, esto a ter outra perceo. Significa que a Frelimo est isolada. Entendam isso, vou lhes dizer, vocs esto a me ouvir. A Frelimos, do ponto de vista diplomtico, est isolada, porque est manchada, porque a Frelimos est mal vista, est vista como um grupo terrorista que assassina. Vejam s os jovens que foram, supostamente, Supostamente os jovens que foram apanhados depois de fugir. Colocar pessoas a andar como ces de gatas e a polcia atrs. Isso foi visto pela comunidade internacional. Ento, estes que esto agora na rua, vocs esto a limpar as ruas, dizem que querem voltar tudo ao normal. Vocs esto a limpar as ruas para legitimar este terrorismo, esta escravido. Por pessoas a andar de gatas que nem ces e a chutar as pessoas por detrs e depois de matar cem jovens a tiro.  isto que vocs querem que seja limpo? Aqui temos que esclarecer o nosso Isto ainda  um assunto para ns resolvermos. Ns ainda temos que continuar a manifestar, temos que continuar a repudiar, porque no  este pas que ns queremos para o futuro. Estamos a perder, sim, eu sei que estamos a perder. Estamos a parar as atividades, sim, mas no h nenhuma. revoluo, no h nenhum pas que j passou de um estgio para o outro sem haver perdas. Claro que havero perdas. Claro que essas perdas, j dissemos, no tm nada a ver com os manifestantes. Foram homens da Cernic que andaram a roubar os armazns, andaram a queimar os bancos, andaram a queimar caminhes, andaram a queimar fbricas e depois querer imputar isso aos prprios manifestantes. A mesma coisa tambm esto a fazer com que eles esto a ser soltos das cadeias. A culpa disto inteiramente  do Bernardino Rafael, a culpa disto  do Partido Frelimo. Isto est mais do que claro. E eu digo uma coisa, agora as pessoas podem no compreender, mas quando o Tribunal Penal Internacional comear a chamar estas pessoas para responderem pelos seus crimes, a toda a gente vai dizer que, ah, sim senhora, afinal tinham razo. Agora temos que nos preocupar com as pessoas que foram mortas, as pessoas que foram feridas, as pessoas que esto detidas, o roubo de votos, a verdade eleitoral. No podemos nos perder de vista. Ns continuamos com o nosso foco. Ontem, balearam o nosso coordenador na Zambsia, o Xadrec. Meteram-lhe dois tiros na barriga e um tiro na cabea. que ns esqueamos disto. Este  o mtodo da Fraligo.  isto que eles querem fazer. E estes jovens, vi alguns jovens a que so conhecidos na praa, dizem, no, temos que limpar a cidade. Vocs so to desumanos que depois de matarem tanta gente, assassinar tanta gente, vocs nem sequer falam disto. Nem sequer falam dos assassinatos dos nossos prprios irmos. Estes senhores so presos, esto detidos, foram usados como cobaias e foram assassinados. Vocs no falam disto. Esto a a dizer que temos que limpar a estrada, querem nos distrair, mas ns no vamos ficar distrados. Est claro, tudo o quanto aconteceu, arrombamentos, vandalismos,  culpa exclusiva do Partido Frelim porque  o mtodo deles. A soltura dos presos  culpa do Partido Frelim. A morte dos presos  culpa do Partido Frelim. Informaes falsas de homens katanas nos bairros  culpa do Partido Frelimo. Disparo escndalas nos bairros  noite  culpa do Partido Frelimo. Ns, as razes da nossa luta esto firmes. Ainda bem, estamos a ter mais apoio internacional agora, mais do que nunca. O que a Frelimo fez foi reforar a nossa prpria luta. Por isso vamos ficar firmes, no vamos vacilar, vamos continuar firmes e vamos para frente. Meus irmos, hoje, amanh, sbado, domingo, temos pessoas para enterrar, temos pessoas por visitar, temos pessoas para receber tratamento mdico e medicamentoso. A verdade  uma,  que ns vamos entrar numa fase, na reta final das nossas manifestaes. Ns no vamos parar. Sbado, domingo, vamos enterrar os nossos irmos, vamos cuidar dos feridos, vamos recolher mais sedo nas nossas casas. Queria recomendar nos bairros, jovens, ns sabemos quem vive nos nossos bairros. No vamos ficar em pnico, no nosso bairro ns sabemos quem  o nosso vizinho, quem vive na nossa rua. Vamos nos encontrar, vamos nos reunir, no para andar a perder tempo toda noite. Fiquemos com apitos, no por causa dos homens katana, por causa da polcia que anda a disparar de um lado para o outro. Esse  que tem que ser o nosso cuidado. A polcia que entra na casa das pessoas e dispara, como dispararam em Luiz Cabral, que meteram seis tiros a um jovem. No vamos perder o nosso foco, andando-nos a cansar, a perder tempo de um lado para o outro. Ns vamos retomar as nossas manifestaes em grande. Ao anncio das manifestaes finais, ou da reta final, aquilo que podemos chamar da ponta de lana. Na segunda-feira, ns vamos indicar qual  a ponta de lana, qual  a reta final, quais so as manifestaes que vo ser diferentes de tudo o quanto fizemos at hoje. Essas que aconteceram agora foram aes do Partido Fralimo que andaram a destruir as coisas. Ns vamos implementar as manifestaes que visam a verdade eleitoral, que visam a justia, que visam de fato Repormos a nossa democracia. Repormos quem verdadeiramente ganhou as eleies.  isso que ns queremos. Isso vamos fazer na segunda-feira. Por isso, segunda-feira no vamos ter nenhuma atividade em Moambique. Vamos ficar atentos. para indicarmos as medidas da fase ponta de lana, ou a fase da reta final. Estamos muito prximos meus irmos, at o dia 15 de janeiro, no  a altura para desistirmos. Aterrorizaram-nos, meteram-nos medos, mataram nossos irmos, sim, mataram-nos, mas estamos na reta final, no vamos desistir no. Ento, ns at o dia 15 temos muitas obrigaes, temos muitos compromissos. Na segunda-feira, meus irmos, vamos anunciar em concreto o que  que ns vamos fazer na reta final, na fase ponta de lana. E na segunda-feira no h nenhum trabalho. A nica coisa que ns vamos admitir so as nossas mamanas do setor informal. As nossas mamanas do setor informal, vamos permitir que elas se movimentem. Segunda-feira vamos ficar parados, vamos ficar atentos, quais so as medidas da ponta de lana. Na segunda-feira passada, ficamos atentos para ouvir a Lcia Ribeiro, o que ela tinha a dizer. O que ela teve a dizer, ns a seguir, vim com o prprio partido Fralim preparado para criar escndalos, fez o escndalo todo. Esta semana foi a semana do escndalo da Fralim. A prxima semana vamos indicar as medidas verdadeiramente daqueles que querem mudanas srias no pas, que no esto preocupados. Agora j sabemos. Isso de vandalizar loja, partir banco, isso no  conosco. Se algum fizer isso,  bom separar isso de ns. O nosso objetivo  a verdade eleitoral,  a democracia,  a questo da represso da justia. Ento na segunda-feira vamos indicar quais as medidas que ns vamos adotar na ponta final, ou na ponta de lana. Ponta de lana. Vamos indicar quais so essas medidas. E agora, em parte, foi positivo para todos ns, porque j sabemos qual  a atuao da Afralim, qual  a atuao da polcia da Afralim, j sabemos exatamente como  que eles manipulam as coisas, ento o povo vai ficar muito claro. do que  a manifestao da verdade eleitoral, o que  a manifestao do terrorismo da FRELIM, que usa a polcia para fazer esse terrorismo, que usa reclusos para fazer esse terrorismo. Na segunda-feira ns vamos indicar as medidas da ponta de lana, a reta final. Estamos prximos, faltam-nos muito pouco. No vamos desanimar, no godolemos, como dizem alguns. Tanto  isto, que eu queria deixar aqui muito bem claro. No desanimemos. Tudo no passou da manipulao do governo.  por isso que esto fugitivos. E  bom continuarem fugitivos. Porque a partir da segunda-feira, o nosso alvo vai ser um alvo muito certeiro. Muito certeiro. Esses ministrios. Governos Provinciais, Governos Distritais, rgos eleitorais, sedes do Partido Fralimo, Presidncia da Repblica, mas depois vamos explicar como  que vamos fazer isso. Portanto, no vo ser lojas, no vo ser supermercados, no vo ser fbricas, no vo ser caminhes, nada disso. Isso tudo j sabemos que agora vamos afastar tudo isso, porque nunca teve nada a ver conosco e agora est claro que foi o Partido Fralimo que fez isso. Ento, na segunda-feira, todos aqueles que querem o Moambique de fato democrtico, querem o Moambique livre da escravatura, vo assumir, vo adotar, vo receber as medidas do verdadeiro Moambicano revolucionrio para a fase ponta de lana. Meus irmos, e assim estivemos, em direto, a partir da pgina oficial de Venncio Molheni. para Moambique, tanto no pas como na dispora. Um forte abrao para todos. Um beijo e tchau!  ZimEye

news.title: BREAKING NEWS…50 Murdered During Christmas
news.content:
By Crime and Courts-The police have raised alarm over the rise in murder cases during the Christmas holiday.

In a statement Friday, the police said 47 such murder caseswere recordedin four days nationwide.

Posted the Police Friday:

TheZimbabwe Republic Policeis concerned with the number of murder cases which arebeing recordedthroughout the country.47cases of murderhavebeen receivedduring the period20th December 2024 to 26th December 2024.

TheZimbabwe Republic Policehas established that the murder cases are emanating from disputes atbeer drinkingbinges or sporting activities, family and community disputes during gatherings, attacks by unknown suspects while walking at night, the settling of scores during Christmas Day by individuals and groups, and fighting over girlfriends, among others.

In one of the caseswhichoccurred on25th December 2024at around1900 hoursatMachipisa Tuckshops, Mwenezi, Triangle,Mastard Chauke (22)had a misunderstanding withTongai Moyo, who had bumped into him during abeer drinkingspree.MastardChaukethrew a stone towardsTongai Moyo, which hitOstern Mangaru (29)on the chest instead. The victim fellonthe ground and died on the spot.

In another murder case which occurred on25th December 2024at around2100 hours,Learnmore Mudzengi (36)stabbedSydney Mudzengi (21)with a Colombian knife onceonthe chest atMusavezi Business Centre, Shurugwi.The suspect allegedly had a misunderstanding with the victim over a tokenwhichwent missingwhilstplaying pool.
